{"step_by_step_thinking": "The arch space for the eruption of the 2nd and 3rd molars is created by changes in the jaw structure. The hamular processes are not involved in this process. The anterior border of the ramus is not resorbed to create space for the molars. The lower border of the mandible does not appose to create space. The posterior border of the ramus, however, does undergo resorption to create space for the molars.", "answer_choice": "C. Resorption of posterior border of ramus"}
